me.tatarka.ipromise

Class Progress<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.tatarka.ipromise.Progress<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the message

    public class Progress<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A progress is a way to return multiple values over time. You cannot construct a progress directly, instead you must get one from a Channel. Unlike a promise, a progress can only have one listener. This is because as messages are consumed, they are no longer available.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Progress.AlreadyAddedListenerException 
      static interface  Progress.Listener<T>
      A listener for receiving the messages of a progress.

      Constructs a progress which immediately delivers the given messages.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Progress

        public Progress(java.util.List<T> messages)
        Constructs a progress which immediately delivers the given messages. This is useful when you can send the messages immediately.
        Parameters:
        messages - the messages to send

      • Progress

        public Progress(T... messages)
        Constructs a progress which immediately delivers the given messages. This is useful when you can send the messages immediately.
        Parameters:
        messages - the messages to send

    • Method Detail

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels the Progress, notifying all listeners and propagating the cancellation to all Progresses that share the CancelToken. A canceled Progress will ignore all subsequent messages.

      • isCanceled

        public boolean isCanceled()
        Returns if the progress has been canceled.
        Returns:
        true if canceled, false otherwise

      • listen

        public Progress<T> listen(Progress.Listener<T> listener)
        Listens to a Progress, receiving messages as they are delivered. Messages are buffered until a Progress.Listener is added, so that none are missed. Only one listener may be added.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to call when the progress receives a message
        Returns:
        the progress for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when a listener has already been added

      • then

        public <T2> Progress<T2> then(Map<T,T2> map)
        Constructs a new progress that receives a message when the original progress receives one but passes the result through the given Map function.
        Type Parameters:
        T2 - the type of the new Progress message.
        Parameters:
        map - the function to chain the result of the original Progress to the new progress
        Returns:
        the new Progress

      • then

        public <T2> Progress<T2> then(Chain<T,Progress<T2>> chain)
        Constructs a new Progress that chains two progresses in succession.
        Type Parameters:
        T2 - the type of the second Progress messages
        Parameters:
        chain - the Chain that constructs the second Progress
        Returns:
        the new Progress

      • cast

        public <T2> Progress<T2> cast()
        Forces a cast of a progress to a super-type to get around covariance restrictions. T2 must be a superclass of T. This is safe because you can't directly deliver messages to the cast progress.
        Type Parameters:
        T2 - the type of the message to cast to
        Returns:
        a cast of the progress
